meanings.definition: The study or practice of bell ringing.
meanings.sent1: Campanology involves learning about the history of different types of bells.
meanings.sent2: The church's campanology group meets every Sunday to practice ringing the bells.
meanings.sent3: During the campanology class, the students accidentally rang the bells out of tune, creating a funny melody.
meanings.sent4: The campanology of the ancient cathedral echoed through the town, signaling the start of the festival.
meanings.sent5: The intricate campanology of the bell tower mesmerized the visitors with its harmonious chimes.

meanings.definition: The art or skill of ringing bells in a musical way.
meanings.sent1: She studied campanology to learn how to play melodies on the church bells.
meanings.sent2: The campanology performance at the concert was met with applause from the audience.
meanings.sent3: The campanology competition challenged participants to ring the bells in creative and melodious patterns.
meanings.sent4: His campanology skills were so refined that he could make the bells sing like a choir.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of her campanology was evident in the enchanting sounds that filled the air.
